etymology.description: pictogram: woman 女 with hands at the midsection, beneath a large eye 目 (later stylized via 角 to 覀); originally meant “waist.”
etymology.interpretation: An early graph shows a person with hands at the waist under a prominent eye element, later regularized as 覀. Its concrete sense of “waist” later shifted by rebus/semantic extension to abstract meanings like “to want” and “important.”

examples.chinese: 我不要咖啡(我不要咖啡)。
我今天要早点走(我今天要早點走)。
examples.english: I need to leave early today.

examples.chinese: 这份文件很重要(這份文件很重要)。
